alert.note: Alert for Breathitt; Lee; Owsley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 12:19AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Owsley, western Breathitt and southeastern Lee Counties through 100 AM EDT... At 1219 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Oakdale, or 8 miles west of Jackson, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Chenowee, Yeadon and Lawson around 1225 AM EDT. Elkatawa, Gentry, Frozen Creek, Fivemile, Vancleve, Wilhurst and Canoe around 1230 AM EDT. Jackson, Inverness, Dumont, Curt, Keck, Howard Creek, Sewell, Copland and Saldee around 1235 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Portsmouth, Quicksand, Smith Branch, Noctor, Haddix, Lost Creek, Taulbee, Little, Wilstacy, Press, Haginsville, Stevenson, Flintville, Clayhole, Watts, Bays, Sikes, Rousseau, Guage, Hardshell, Lunah, Camp Lewis and Noble. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
